IRS990.MissionDesc: TO FIND AND CARE FOR THE ABANDONED POOR AND BE FAMILY TO THOSE WHO
IRS990.Desc: BETHESDA PROJECT HOUSED 173 MEN AND WOMEN IN 9 TRANSITIONAL AND PERMANENT RESIDENCES WHILE SHELTERING APPROXIMATELY 181 MORE MEN ON A NIGHTLY BASIS IN 2 DISTINCT FACILITIES. DURING THE WINTER MONTHS, BETHESDA PROJECT PROVIDED EMERGENCY DROP-IN SERVICES AND SHELTER TO AN ADDITIONAL 52 MEN, ON A NIGHTLY BASIS. BETHESDA PROJECT ALSO PROVIDED SUPPORTIVE SOCIAL SERVICES (MEDICATION MONITORING, HEALTH EDUCATION, CASE MANAGEMENT, TRANSPORTATION, ADL'S) TO THE MEN AND WOMEN IN OUR CARE.

Form990ScheduleAPartVIGrp.ExplanationTxt: Other Income Part II, Line 10 Description: MISCELLANEOUS 2013: 4534. 2014: 3480. 2015: 2624. 2016: 31662. 2017: 34332.

OtherAssetsOrgGrp.Desc: Due To/From BETHESDA PROJECT SPRUCE ST DEVEL. CORP.

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE ORGANIZATION RECEIVES FUTURE DISTRIBUTIONS OF THE FUND'S EARNINGS WHICH ARE SPENT FOR THE ORGANIZATION'S BENEFIT. THE SPENDING POLICY IS DESIGNED TO MAINTAIN AND IF POSSIBLE INCREASE THE REAL VALUE OF THE FUND WHILE PROVIDING A STEADY LEVEL OF DISTRIBUTIONS FOR CHARITABLE PURPOSES.
IMPUTED INTEREST REVENUE & SPECIAL EVENT EXPENSES
IMPUTED INTEREST AND SPECIAL EVENTS EXPENSES

Bethesda Project has adopted current accounting principles for uncertain income tax positions that require evaluation of tax positions taken on its income tax returns and recognizing a tax asset or liability if the position would not be sustained under audit. Bethesda Project's policy is to record interest and penalties from tax examinations as income taxes. For federal income tax purposes, the returns remain open for possible examination three years after they are filed.
CHAIR OF THE AUDIT COMMITTEE ANNUALLY DISTRIBUTES COPIES OF THE CONFLICT POLICIES TO ALL MEMBERS OF THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS AND KEY EMPLOYEES, AND SEES TO THEIR COMPLETION, RETURN, REVIEW AND FILING.

IN REVIEWING COMPENSATION OF ALL KEY EMPLOYEES THE BOARD RELIES ON COMPENSATION COMMITTEE THAT EMPLOYS KNOWLEDGE OF COMPENSATION PAID TO SIMILAR LEVEL EMPLOYEES IN SIMILAR AREA ORGANIZATIONS USING SURVEYS PREPARED BY INDEPENDENT PARTIES AND THROUGH PERSONAL KNOWLEDGE.
GOVERNING DOCUMENTS, CONFLICT STATEMENTS, AND FINANCIAL REPORTS ARE MADE AVAILABLE FOR PUBLIC INSPECTION UPON REQUEST AND THE ORGANIZATION'S REPORTS TO DONORS, ETC, STATE THAT POLICY.
REVIEW CONDUCTED BY ORGANIZATION AUDIT COMMITTEE

THE DRAFT 990 IS DISTRIBUTED TO THE CHIEF EXECUTIVE OFFICER (CEO), THE BOARD CHAIR, THE FINANCE COMMITTEE CHAIR, THE AUDIT COMMITTEE CHAIR AND THE FULL AUDIT COMMITTEE. THE CEO, THE FINANCE COMMITTEE CHAIR AND JEANNE STAGLOFF, THE AUDIT COMMITTEE CHAIR ALL HAVE EXTENSIVE EXPERIENCE WITH REVIEWING THE 990. ALL COMMENTS ARE THEN SENT BACK TO THE PREPARER. THE 990 IS THEN DISTRIBUTED TO THE FULL BOARD PRIOR TO ITS ISSUANCE.

THE CEO AND HUMAN RESOURCES WILL DETERMINE ALL OTHER COMPENSATION BASED UPON POSITION AND COMPENSATION OF SIMILIAR LOCAL NON-PROFITS, THIS IS THEN PUT FORTH TO THE HR COMMITTEE FOR CONSIDERATION. ANNUAL INCREASE ALSO PART OF BUDGETARY PROCESS.
